docs.snippet: THE NEW-YORK OPTHALMIC HOSPITAL COMMENCEMENT. The New-York Opthalmic Hospital held its annual commencement for the Session 1860 and '61, at the University Medical College, Fourteenthstreet.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE NEW-YORK OPTHALMIC HOSPITAL COMMENCEMENT. The New-York Opthalmic Hospital held its annual commencement for the Session 1860 and '61, at the University Medical College, Fourteenthstreet.

docs.snippet: Our Washington dispatches this morning are highly important, and indicate that the question of reinforcing Forts Sumpter and Pickens will soon be decided. Indeed, so far as Fort sumpter is concerned, it may have been decided already.
docs.lead_paragraph: Our Washington dispatches this morning are highly important, and indicate that the question of reinforcing Forts Sumpter and Pickens will soon be decided. Indeed, so far as Fort sumpter is concerned, it may have been decided already.

docs.snippet: The U.S. Mail steamship Quaker City, R.W. SHUFELDT, commander, left Havana at 1 P. M., March 5, and arrived at her wharf yesterday.

headline.main: FROM HAVANA.; Arrival of the Quaker City Preparations for the Reception of Prince Alfred, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Mail steamship Quaker City, R.W. SHUFELDT, commander, left Havana at 1 P. M., March 5, and arrived at her wharf yesterday.

headline.main: AFFAIRS OF THE NATION.; PROGRESS OF EVENTS IN WASHINGTON No More Nominations Sent to the Senate. Who the Candidates are and their Relative Chances. Interesting Debate on the Inaugural Address. Messrs. Wigfall and Mason Consider it a Declaration of War. Mr. Douglas Again in the President's Defence. The Diplomatic Corps Introduced at the White House. The Southern Commissioners Conclude to Defer Action. GROWING UNION SENTIMENT IN VIRGINA, OUR WASHINGTON DISPATCHES. SPARRING BETWEEN DOUGLAS AND WIGFALL. THE COMMISSIONERS FROM THE SOUTHERN CONFEDERACY. VISIT OF THE DIPLOMATIC CORPS. MEETING OF THE CABINET, AND APPOINTMENTS CORRECTED LIST OF NEW YORK APPLICANTS FOR OFFICE. THE NEW-YORK CITY POST-OFFICE. THE BROOKLYN POST-OFFICE. THE NEW-YORK SURVEYORSHIP. THE DEPUTY-COLLECTORSHIP OF NEW-YORK. APPRAISERSHIP. THE BOSTON COLLECTORSHIP. THE MISSION TO MEXICO. THE MISSION TO ENGLAND. CHIEF CLERK IN THE NAVY DEPARTMENT. ENGINEERING BUREAU. THE WASHINGTON MARSHALSHIP. REMOVALS IN WASHINGTON. SENATOR CRITTENDEN AND THE SUPREME COURT. A SERENADE T

docs.snippet: The New-Orleans Picayune, of the 2d inst., contains Galveston (Texas) dates of the 26th ultime. The Texas forces under Col. FORD, accompanied by Commissioner NICHOLS, found at Brazos twenty soldiers under Lieut. THOMPSON, about twenty heavy guns and...

headline.main: STATE OF AFFAIRS IN TEXAS.; CAPT. HILL STILL HOLDS OUT AGAINST THE STATE TROOPS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The New-Orleans Picayune, of the 2d inst., contains Galveston (Texas) dates of the 26th ultime. The Texas forces under Col. FORD, accompanied by Commissioner NICHOLS, found at Brazos twenty soldiers under Lieut. THOMPSON, about twenty heavy guns and plenty of artillery, stores, ammunition, etc. Capt. HILL had previously withdrawn his light battery, and with his party was en route to Brazos to dostroy the gun-carriages and immovables there.
